meta_description: The Bronx Museum of the Arts is a contemporary art museum that connects diverse audiences to the urban experience through its permanent collection, special exhibitions, and education programs that strive to reflect the borough’s dynamic communities.
hours_text:
#  [ The  Bronx Museum ](https://bronxmuseum.org) Visitor Guide 

##  Please Note: 

  * The Museum is temporarily closed for exhibition installation, beginning at 6:00 PM on Sunday, January 11, 2026. It will reopen with a [celebration](https://bronxmuseum.org/event/opening-aim-biennial7/) for [_The Seventh AIM Biennial: Forms of Connection_](https://bronxmuseum.org/exhibition/seventh-aim-biennial/) on Friday, January 23, 2026, at 6:00 PM.
  * A [transformative renovation](https://bronxmuseum.org/about-us/renovation2026/) of the Museum’s south wing is currently underway and is expected to reopen in the coming year! While this project is underway, our north wing remains open at regular operating hours.

##  ADMISSION & ACCESSIBILITY 

  * Admission to the Museum and all of our [exhibitions](https://bronxmuseum.org/exhibitions/) and [events](https://bronxmuseum.org/events/) is always **FREE FOR EVERYONE.**
  * All exhibition and educational materials are available in both English and in Spanish.
  * Public areas of the Museum, including galleries and restrooms, are wheelchair accessible. Complimentary wheelchairs are available in the lobby area on a first-come, first-served basis. Service animals are welcome, but must be on a leash and attended at all times.
  * If you are planning a visit for 10 or more people, please visit our [Group Tours](https://bronxmuseum.org/learn/tours/) page and complete the required forms. We are not able to accommodate large groups of visitors arriv...
